intro: Stachytarpheta jamaicensis var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, making it an important plant in ecological gardens. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its vibrant color and hardy nature.
